publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-530 Mr John McAllion: Dispersal of Civil Service Jobs to Tayside—That the Parliament notes the repeated rhetorical commitment by Ministers that they will ensure that the Scottish Parliament works for all and not just part of Scotland, and in that context calls for serious consideration to be given to the dispersal of civil service and quango jobs to Tayside and for an annual review by the Parliament of progress achieved in dispersing such jobs across Scotland. Supported by: Kate Maclean*, Mr John Swinney*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Mr Andrew Welsh*

S1M-530 Mr John McAllion: Dispersal of Civil Service Jobs to Tayside-That the Parliament notes the repeated rhetorical commitment by Ministers that they will ensure that the Scottish Parliament works for all and not just part of Scotland, and in that context calls for serious consideration to be given to the dispersal of civil service and quango jobs to Tayside and for an annual review by the Parliament of progress achieved in dispersing such jobs across Scotland. Supported by: Kate Maclean, Mr John Swinney, Roseanna Cunningham, Mr Andrew Welsh

S1M-530 Dispersal of Civil Service Jobs to Tayside (lodged on 10 February 2000) Mr Keith Raffan*
S1M-530 Dispersal of Civil Service Jobs to Tayside (lodged on 10 February 2000) Brian Adam*
